Evidence: the truly affected component may be org.jooby:jooby, according to the patch: https://github.com/jooby-project/jooby/pull/1368/commits/34856a738829d8fedca4ed27bd6ff413af87186f, the current version is io.jooby:jooby, but the affected version is org.jooby:jooby

as mentioned in the poc, https://github.com/xuxueli/xxl-conf/issues/61, the ConfController.java line 150 are affected, and this method is located in https://github.com/xuxueli/xxl-conf/blob/6726dfe7979ea6d8fb983771471cde69789de632/xxl-conf-admin/src/main/java/com/xxl/conf/admin/controller/ConfController.java, the scope can be more specific: com.xuxueli:xxl-conf-admin

according to the cve desc: 'not properly verify the signature of JSON Web Tokens', and in the patch: https://github.com/ManyDesigns/Portofino/commit/8c754a0ad234555e813dcbf9e57d637f9f23d8fb#diff-8a8b092c544d8d29123de4a051fc204cf45c9b463382e93f9e24f443a22fa987, we can fine the affected components are portofino-core and portofino-dispatcher

according to the advisory(https://nifi.apache.org/security.html#CVE-2019-12421) and patch(https://github.com/apache/nifi/commit/cf6f5172503ce438c6c22c334c9367f774db7b24), the affected compoents are in nifi-web, more specifically, nifi-web-security and nifi-web-api

the advisory is: https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-07-31/#SECURITY1422, the patch is: https://github.com/jenkinsci/workflow-cps-global-lib-plugin/commit/6fce1e241d82641e8648c546bc63c22a5e07e96b, the artifact id is org.jenkins-ci.plugins.workflow:workflow-cps-global-lib(https://github.com/jenkinsci/workflow-cps-global-lib-plugin/blob/6fce1e241d82641e8648c546bc63c22a5e07e96b/pom.xml)
according to the patch: https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/3035/commits/1baead6f525046a613fc4fe494a0d193776ea70f, the affected component is org.apache.nifi:nifi-framework-cluster
the affected maven component may not contain information about version, it is not standardized
we found the opensymphony xwork affected version is below 2.0.4, and com.opensymphony:xwork is > 2.0.4, the affected ga is opensymphony:xwork actually.

OpenWire protocol head of Apache ActiveMQ Artemis 2.15.0 (artifactid: artemis-openwire-protocol) bypassed policy based access control for the entire session, https://github.com/apache/activemq-artemis/pull/3315/files
Improper control of code resources vulnerability in Crafter Studio of Crafter CMS allows authenticated developers to execute OS commands via FreeMarker static methods in org.craftercms:crafter-engine

the advisory is https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/security_considerations/#cve-2020-8828-insecure-default-administrative-password, the github repo is: https://github.com/argoproj/argo, and the module name in go.mod is github.com/argoproj/argo-workflows

Whereas the default JMX implementation is hardened against unauthenticated deserialization attacks, the implementation used by Apache Karaf is not protected against this kind of attack. this is the advisory: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KARAF-7312; this is the patch to avoid deserialization: https://github.com/apache/karaf/pull/1475/files

Apache CXF can integrate with JMX using an InstrumentationManager extension. If the 'createMBServerConnectorFactory' property of the default InstrumentationManagerImpl is not disabled, it is vulnerable to MITM attacks. And the 'createMBServerConnectorFactory' property of the default InstrumentationManagerImpl is in org.apache.cxf:cxf-rt-management (https://github.com/apache/cxf/blob/5c64b7a10227d59cd61f9e61a64496e57bf2e1b6/rt/management/src/main/java/org/apache/cxf/management/jmx/InstrumentationManagerImpl.java#L59) and artifact org.apache.cxf:cxf-bundle contain org.apache.cxf:cxf-rt-management which is also affected
This affects use of org.restlet.ext.jaxrs (Jax-rs extension). Ref: https://github.com/restlet/restlet-framework-java/wiki/XEE-security-enhancements
Neo4j through 3.4.18 exposes an RMI service that arbitrarily deserializes Java objects, the exploit is worked with shellserver in neo4j-shell-3.4.18.jar: https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/50170

Apache Karaf has a features deployer for hot deploying features XML via the deploy folder, the key of this cve is the XMLInputFactory class in org.apache.karaf.specs.java.xml lacks XXE mitigation codes and be vulnerable https://github.com/apache/karaf/pull/611/files#diff-10d58eff148ff1f902579e2a23ca30669aae268c0337070374c3fdc9c9461833.

it affect org.jenkins-ci.plugins.workflow:workflow-cps-global-lib, the advisory is https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-02-15/#SECURITY-2441, the patch is https://github.com/jenkinsci/workflow-cps-global-lib-plugin/commit/ace0de3c2d691662021ea10306eeb407da6b6365

In trytond/model/modelstorage.py in Tryton, an authenticated user can order records based on a field for which he has no access right. It would be more appropriate to adjust the affected component to trytond(https://pypi.org/project/trytond/) instead of tryton(https://pypi.org/project/tryton/).

affected modul is github.com:opencontainers:distribution-spec:specs-go, place in github repo: https://github.com/opencontainers/distribution-spec/blob/main/specs-go/go.mod, place in go website: https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/opencontainers/distribution-spec/specs-go

actually orientdb-studio contain many small compoents, and orientdb-server is the affected one as cve says: server/network/protocol/http/OHttpSessionManager.java in the Studio component in OrientDB Server, the patch path: https://github.com/orientechnologies/orientdb/commit/668ece96be210e742a4e2820a3085b215cf55104
org.apache.atlas:apache-atlas is the vulnerable component according to the cve desc: Apache Atlas versions 0.8.3 and 1.1.0 were found vulnerable

as mentioned in path https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/5853d492b3a274db0d94d560e2a5ea988a271c62#diff-f16636e21658a0cc4675a4b2e67b352e62316cfc55898888bdffda291edd19c6, the svg is forbidden not only in xwiki-platform-oldcore but in xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources, so the affected components contain org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources

there are not maven ga named io.jenkins.plugins:nuget, mayby you mean org.jenkins-ci.plugins:nuget? there is the security advisory https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2021-05-25/#SECURITY-2340 and component github repo: https://github.com/jenkinsci/nuget-plugin

In Apache NiFi, the download token mechanism had a fixed cache size and lacked authentication for token creation and the unauthenticated code is located in nifi-web-security component as you can seen in the patch: https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/4271/files

as this cve says, the NiFi stateless execution engine produced log output which included sensitive property values, so we think the org.apache.nifi:nifi-stateless is the truly one of affected components and the patch can be considered: https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/4222/files#diff-eb305cbea432a90d9f07a7ace6471952eae1d41a85be46733574f0c47a92c991

according to https://lists.apache.org/thread/6jgff6fcpok5b5vl39dqbyc5s76v4642, the affected component is https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/tika/tika-server/1.9/tika-server-1.9.jar, and it says: Usage of Apache Tika as a standard library is not affected.
as cve says: However, HTTP InputSource allows authenticated users to read data from other sources than intended, and the InputSource.class is located in druid-core

code.gitea.io:gitea(https://pkg.go.dev/code.gitea.io/gitea?tab=versions) and  github.com:go-gitea:gitea(https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/go-gitea/gitea?tab=versions) contain the vulnerable version(1.7.2, 1.7.3) both
as cve desc: parseObject in Fastjson, as used in FastjsonEngine in Pippo and other products allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code, pippo-fastjson may be one of the affected components
the advisory: https://lists.apache.org/thread/fjynj57rd99s814rdn5hzvmx8lz403q2, the patch: https://github.com/apache/activemq-artemis/pull/3862/files

as the cve says: 'since there is no validation of an existing user name while renaming a user', validation of an existing user name actually exist in opennms-config, we consider the org.opennms:opennms-config is the direct affected component, and the patch is: https://github.com/OpenNMS/opennms/commit/607151ea8f90212a3fb37c977fa57c7d58d26a84#diff-dda388de00d44f44045e179a017347e7f9ebb09c4b855ec1f88ff611616a9217

as the issue in cve: the affected class is ureport2-core/src/main/java/com/bstek/ureport/provider/report/ReportProvider.java, and located in com.bstek.ureport:ureport2-core
the direct affected component is io.undertow:undertow-servlet, there is the patch: https://github.com/undertow-io/undertow/pull/794/commits/d2715e3afa13f50deaa19643676816ce391551e9

The name of the Go module is defined in the go.mod file, and the real module is called istio.io/istio in go.mod (https://github.com/istio/istio/blob/release-1.8/go.mod), according to cve, before 1.8.6 and 1.9.x before 1.9.5 are affected

the patch is: https://github.com/apache/ozone/commit/60e078729e18ef1be276f35659957ac553d266f7, and the affected component is org.apache.ozone:hadoop-ozone-ozone-manager in https://github.com/apache/ozone/blob/60e078729e18ef1be276f35659957ac553d266f7/hadoop-ozone/ozone-manager/pom.xml

in the patch (https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/pull/7053/files#diff-0e2be7153ad8d3c0750e5f355de884baa6f518d6d5c4ca152680ce2a11f2298d), keycloak-common and keycloak-core contains usages of ObjectInputStream without type checks
in the patch (https://github.com/apache/incubator-livy/commit/4d8a912699683b973eee76d4e91447d769a0cb0d), the affected component is org.apache.livy:livy-server

according to the advisory and patch: https://cxf.apache.org/security-advisories.data/CVE-2015-5175.txt.asc?version=1&modificationDate=1440598018000&api=v2, https://github.com/apache/cxf-fediz/commit/f65c961ea31e3c1851daba8e7e49fc37bbf77b19, in the pox.xml, the org.apache.cxf.fediz:fediz-idp and org.apache.cxf.fediz:fediz-core is affected https://github.com/apache/cxf-fediz/blob/f65c961ea31e3c1851daba8e7e49fc37bbf77b19/services/idp/pom.xml, https://github.com/apache/cxf-fediz/blob/f65c961ea31e3c1851daba8e7e49fc37bbf77b19/plugins/core/pom.xml

according to the patch: https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly/pull/14136/files, the component more specifically affected by the vulnerability is wildfly-metrics

according to the patch: https://github.com/robo-code/robocode/commit/836c84635e982e74f2f2771b2c8640c3a34221bd#diff-583a22a38f0e8bf8e02ebb121bc19e8792db894f5069946e24b716ca0a26e9e3, robocode.host is affected
according to the issue: https://github.com/ming-soft/MCMS/issues/59, net/mingsoft/basic/action/TemplateAction.java and net/mingsoft/basic/util/BasicUtil.java in ms-basic is affected more specifically
netty-all contains netty-codec, is vulnerable as well
according to cve(https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-17197),'A carefully crafted or corrupt sqlite file can cause an infinite loop in Apache Tika's SQLite3Parser'

according to cve desc: 'Apache NiFi External XML Entity issue in SplitXML processor', the SplitXML processor is in nifi-standard-processors (https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/nifi/nifi-standard-processors/1.5.0/nifi-standard-processors-1.5.0.jar)

according to this patch: https://github.com/apache/accumulo/pull/1828/files, when accumulo-manager do not throw exceptions, allowing an authenticated user flushing a table, shutting down Accumulo or an individual tablet server, and setting or removing system-wide Accumulo configuration properties without permission

according to the advisory(https://nifi.apache.org/security.html#CVE-2020-1942) and patch in this advisory(https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/4028/files) ,the affected component is org.apache.nifi:nifi-framework-core and org.apache.nifi:nifi-security-utils

according to the cve desc: 'An issue was discovered in RouterNanoHTTPD.java in NanoHTTPD through 2.3.1.', and the RouterNanoHTTPD is located in org.nanohttpd:nanohttpd-nanolets (https://github.com/NanoHttpd/nanohttpd/blob/efb2ebf85a2b06f7c508aba9eaad5377e3a01e81/nanolets/src/main/java/org/nanohttpd/router/RouterNanoHTTPD.java#L64), the pom.xml (https://github.com/NanoHttpd/nanohttpd/blob/efb2ebf85a2b06f7c508aba9eaad5377e3a01e81/nanolets/pom.xml) shows the coordiante of this component.
